intro: Wigandia urens var. caracasana, commonly known as the "Caracas beauty" or "yellow crown flower," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive crown-like structure. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
